meanings.definition: Having a spherical or rounded shape.
meanings.sent1: The bouncy ball was globulars and rolled smoothly on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The orange was globulars in shape, perfectly round and juicy.

meanings.definition: A group of stars that are closely clustered together in a spherical shape.
meanings.sent1: The telescope revealed a cluster of globulars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers study the globulars to understand more about the universe.
meanings.sent3: The globulars twinkled like tiny diamonds in the vast darkness of space.
meanings.sent4: The globulars shone brightly, creating a beautiful pattern in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The globulars formed a stunning constellation, captivating all who gazed at them.

meanings.definition: A type of galaxy that is spherical or nearly spherical in shape.
meanings.sent1: The scientist discovered a new globulars in the distant galaxy.
meanings.sent2: The globulars contained billions of stars, all tightly packed together.
meanings.sent3: Aliens in the globulars galaxy communicated through light signals.
